title: Is there a way to control 2 computers with one mouse and keyboard while mirroring key actions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Strictly software solution:If you are on Windows OS then you can login to one computer and connect to other computer through  "Remote Desktop Connection". This way you can control more than one computer simultaneously with one keyboard or mouse. Similar solutions are available on Linux and other UNIX flavors. Hardware solution:There are KVM products that provide facility to control more than one computers simultaneously with one KB & mouse. KVM product cost is generally based on number of supported computer connections.

Are we talking remotely or in the same work space? Remotely, you can use software like Remote Desktop, which comes pre-installed on Windows. If they are side by side, buy a KVM splitter. It lets you plug multiple keyboards, mice, and monitors into one hub and lets you switch freely between them.
